headline: This day in history, May 6: German airship Hindenburg catches fire and crashes while attempting to dock at Lakehurst
author: Associated Press
sentences:
Todays Highlight in History:
On May 6, 1937, the hydrogen-filled German airship Hindenburg caught fire and crashed while attempting to dock at Lakehurst, New Jersey; 35 of the 97 people on board were killed along with a crewman on the ground.

In 1910, Britains Edwardian era ended with the death of King Edward VII; he was succeeded by George V.
In 1935, the Works Progress Administration began operating under an executive order signed by President Franklin D. Roosevelt.

In 2013, kidnap-rape victims Amanda Berry, Gina DeJesus and Michelle Knight, who went missing separately about a decade earlier while in their teens or early 20s, were rescued from a house just south of downtown Cleveland.

Five years ago: A Nigerian military official said 83 Chibok (chih-BAWK) schoolgirls had been released more than three years after they were abducted from their boarding school by Boko Haram (BOH-koh hah-RAHM) extremists.

Ron DeSantis signed a 48-page elections bill that Republicans said would guard against fraud and vote harvesting; Democrats and voting rights advocates said it was an attempt to make it harder for some people to vote.

In 2004, President George W. Bush apologized for the abuse of Iraqi prisoners by American soldiers, calling it a stain on our countrys honor?; he rejected calls for Defense Secretary Donald Rumsfelds resignation.

On this date:
In 1882, President Chester Alan Arthur signed the Chinese Exclusion Act, which barred Chinese immigrants from the U.S. for 10 years (Arthur had opposed an earlier version with a 20-year ban).
Ten years ago: Vice President Joe Biden told NBCs Meet the Press? he was absolutely comfortable? with gay couples who marry getting the same civil rights and liberties as heterosexual couples.
President Donald Trump reversed course on plans to wind down his COVID-19 task force; he said the force would shift its focus toward rebooting the economy and developing a vaccine.
In 2010, a computerized sell order triggered a flash crash? on Wall Street, sending the Dow Jones industrials to a loss of nearly 1,000 points in less than half an hour.
In 2020, New York City began shutting down its subway system overnight to allow for additional cleaning and disinfecting of cars and stations amid the pandemic.
Comedian Bob Hope did his first USO show before an audience of servicemen as he broadcast his radio program from March Field in Riverside, California.
Socialist Francois Hollande (frahn-SWAH oh-LAWND) defeated conservative incumbent Nicolas Sarkozy (sahr-koh-ZEE) to become Frances next president.
In 2006, Lillian Gertrud Asplund, the last American survivor of the sinking of the Titanic, died in Shrewsbury, Massachusetts, at age 99.
In 1994, former Arkansas state worker Paula Jones filed suit against President Bill Clinton, alleging hed sexually harassed her in 1991.
(Their captor, Ariel Castro, hanged himself in prison in September 2013 at the beginning of a life sentence plus 1,000 years.)
In 1942, during World War II, some 15,000 American and Filipino troops on Corregidor island surrendered to Japanese forces.
In 1954, medical student Roger Bannister broke the four-minute mile during a track meet in Oxford, England, in 3:59.4.
(Pujols would finish the season with the Los Angeles Dodgers, before returning to the St. Louis Cardinals in 2022.)
In an election-year surprise, Atlanta Mayor Keisha Lance Bottoms announced that she would not seek a second term.
In 1941, Josef Stalin assumed the Soviet premiership, replacing Vyacheslav (VEE-cheh-slav) M. Molotov.
Actor George Lindsey, Goober? on The Andy Griffith Show,? died in Nashville at age 83.

---
The first draft of history at your fingertips at newspapers.com.
The Los Angeles Angels cut 41-year-old superstar Albert Pujols.
Todays birthdays: Baseball Hall of Famer Willie Mays is 91.
(Jones reached a settlement with Clinton in November 1998.)
Journalism, its often said, is the first-draft of history.
Rock musician Mark Bryan (Hootie and the Blowfish) is 55.
